intro: Senecio sublobatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Senecio sublobatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
